newsitem.title: JAPAN: Russia's energy minister to visit Japan.
newsitem.headline: Russia's energy minister to visit Japan.

text.p: First Deputy Prime Minister Boris Nemstov will visit Japan next week to court new energy investment in the Russian Far East, a Russian embassy official said on Wednesday.
Nemstov, who also serves as Russia's Fuel and Energy Minister following the April resignation of former minister Pyotr Rodionov, will visit Japan from June 9 to June 11, the official said.
Japan's foreign ministry, which will announce the Russian visit this evening, said no specific schedule for Nemstov has been set.
But discussions will likely address the existing Sakhalin I and Sakhalin II development plans, the Russian embassy said.
The two projects are production-sharing oil and gas deals with Western and Japanese companies in the Far Eastern Russian island of Sakhalin, near Japan.
Japan's Foreign Minister Yukihiko Ikeda visited Moscow in late May to discuss ways of pushing forward oil projects and other economic co-operation issues with Russia.
Nemstov and Ikeda co-chair a joint Russian-Japan commission on trade and economic issues.
